title: Stealth is an unfun mechanic that lacks counterplay.
body:
Unless you managed to say tether them with an ability that grants true sight, you have no other option of spotting them if you don't count the shit way a red trinket allows you to "see" them. Camouflage is a lot more balanced as you can spot them by being near them or simply using red wards to play around them. It's a lot more healthy to play against. 

Why should a champion like shaco come out of nowhere and one shot me with his auto while i am unable to react? Rengar I can see coming with his ult notification and the fact that he has a travel time jumping at you. Eve usually engages by using her charm and you are able to react if she comes close to you to land her ability or auto you.

Shaco has almost no counterplay to an already easy to use kit.

In one of his more recent comments on Reddit, Scarizard commented on how champion design tends to have peaks and valleys of counterplay: some parts of a kit tend to have more counterplay than others, and when a champion has a feature that specifically is low on counterplay, then they should have to make up for it by having an especially large amount of meaningful counterplay elsewhere. This, I think, should apply to stealth, so while I don't think going invisible is necessarily bad in itself (champions are largely invisible as they roam around the map, for example, even with proper ward placement), I take issue with how so many stealth champions can also one-shot people. Shaco and Kha'Zix are currently among the worst offenders, as both have their damage loaded in such a manner that they can kill people within the first few moments of popping out of stealth, which makes them uninteractive overall.

If a champion could attack anyone from stealth, but then took actual time to kill them, they would likely still be healthy in spite of their stealth, and I think this is the kind of philosophy that should be applied to these champions: instead of necessarily trying to give stealth itself more counterplay, it might help to give these champions counterplay when they're actually fighting, namely by giving their opponents a chance to escape or fight back. I know that's a painful thing to say in an environment where the targets for assassins can usually take advantage of that small window to receive craptons of shields, heals and peel, but then again the latter is the problem, more than the former (assuming the slower burst is done right, rather than forced awkwardly into those champions' kits).

Stealth as a WHOLE is actually a healthy mechanic that has counterplay

the problem is that there are specific abusers of stealth that LACK that counterplay

Ex:  {{champion:28}} has a form of stealth that forces her to either:

A:
Get CC but let enemies know where you are coming from while giving them a huge chance to run away

or

B:
Get some free damage but you can't CC anyone with half a brain

In both situations, Evelynn loses out on something which makes it more fair for people fighting against her Stealth because Evelynn can never have the best of those two situations without giving up the other situation
 Evelynn's main goal is to kill valuable targets until EXTREME lategame(50+ minutes) in which she becomes a way to pressure enemy ADCs off from fighting teams and she looks to 1v1 skirmish before teamfights

Second Ex:
Kha'zix

Kha's stealth has _**NO**_ downsides to using it once it's been activated. The only time that a Kha player can misuse their stealth is when they are entirely alone(and know that they are alone) which is EXTREEMLY unlikely to happen

Kha's stealth enhances his main goal, to kill valuable targets until lategame where he wants to kill targets before teamfights
------------------
A Kha player can do more than the Evelynn player with the damage they are both given BECAUSE his stealth allows him to do his job _better_ than what Evelynn can

This in turn means that Kha's stealth is unhealthy due to the interactions it has with his kit. Evelynn's stealth, however, is extremely healthy due to how it forces her and her opponents to play around it(with chances for both sides to mess up horribly).

It is nigh-impossible for a Kha'Zix to mess up spamming all of their abilities on an enemy. It is up to Kha's enemies entirely to mess up in order for Kha to win an even fight(1v1, 2v2, etc)

It's extremely possible for an Evelyn to mess up her abilities if she doesn't use them correctly. It's up to both Evelynn to succeed and up to Enemies to evade Evelynn's advances for situations to play out properly

If an enemy messes up against Kha'Zix they will lose if they are isolated. If an enemy messes up against Evelynn they have a chance to succeed because the Evelynn CAN mess up

In other words Stealth as a whole is fine but champs like Kha'Zix, Akali, Shaco, and Twitch are outliers whom abuse stealth due to their kits not functioning around the sheer POWER of stealth

If each of those champs had their power levels stripped until proper usage of their stealth mechanics made them good or bad(depending on player skill entirely) then that would make them balanced
